sentences.sContent: an electronic organizer (= a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc )
...90% of parents said that their children younger than 2 consumed some form of electronic media...
...some hospitals have begun　limiting the use of electronic devices in critical settings...
...hoping to find some guiding principles for parenting in the electronic age...
...As electronic communication is not limited by space...
...a real hug from our parents or friends can mean much more to us than just words through electronic communication...
...others are under the impression that electronic communication can replace face-to-face contact...
...We tend to pay more attention to electronic communication than to face-to-face contact...
...There is no consensus of opinions among people regarding whether electronic communication can replace face-to-face contact...
...I still don’t think the electronic communication can replace face-to-face contact...
...It is no doubt that face-to-face contact is inevitably impaired by electronic communication in the era of Internet...

phrases.pCn: 电子产品；电子设备制造业
电子设施，电子器件；电子仪表
电子镇流器；电子安定器
使用电脑控制之武器的战争，电子战争

remMethod.val: 以上四词均来自electric(adj. 电的)

trans.tranOther: electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc
